intro: Myrceugenia pinifolia, commonly known as the coastal myrtle, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a leathery texture, while its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Myrceugenia pinifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
